page.title: 12TREKILLICK FARM
page.content: Trekillick farm is owned and farmed by Mr. John Dyer and his son Colin. The land covers a total of 126 acres with another 35 acres of grassland rented at Innis and 25 acres at Dunmere. All crops grown are for feeding the animals which consist of 87 cows and 149 bullocks. The farm was purchased in 1935. Since that time, field enlargements have taken place and in doing so a local landmark has been destroyed. There was, until a few years ago a field on the side of the hill with a strange shape. From the Lanivet side it was called the Leg of Mutton field and from Bodmin it was called the "Chimney Pot". Also on the farm is an adit dating back to the last century in the mining era.
